tool.name: Tool6

param.name: input_WA_folder
param.displayname: Folder containing all window analysis files (Level A folder: 'Window_R_Input')
param.dialogReference: This is the parent folder containing Level B subfolders (e.g., Union_M1, Union_M2, Intersect_M1M2). Inside each Level B folder, the tool looks for the Log folder and processes the CSV files corresponding to different variations (Accum, Median, Max, Min).

param.name: output_folder
param.displayname: Output folder for all logistic regression files
param.dialogReference:
The folder where the logistic regression results will be saved. The tool will create subfolders based on Level B folders and variations to organize the output.

The tool creates a structured set of output folders based on the Level B folder (e.g., Union_M1, Union_M2) and variations (Accum_LogROutput, Median_LogROutput, etc.). For each processed file, the results are saved to a CSV file with _results.csv appended to the file name.

param.name: include_population_density
param.displayname: Include Population Density in Logistic Regression
param.dialogReference: [optional] Check the box if you would like Population Density to be included as an explanatory variable in the logistic regression. (Default is unchecked -- exclude Population density)

tool.summary: This tool performs logistic regression on window analysis data across multiple variations (Accum, Median, Max, Min). It processes CSV files, calculates odds ratios, and outputs results to specified folders, including confidence intervals for each variation.

Consts.useLimit:
Odds Ratio: Calculated using the natural exponential function (np.exp()).

Population Density is excluded as an explan. variable

95% Confidence Interval: Calculated using the formula np.exp(coef ± 1.96 * Std.Err.).

99% Confidence Interval: Calculated using the formula np.exp(coef ± 2.58 * Std.Err.).
